name: predestined
examples: it seemed predestined since the beginning of the world

definition: (theology) being determined in advance; especially the doctrine (usually associated with Calvin) that God has foreordained every event throughout eternity (including the final salvation of mankind)
name: predetermination

definition: a mental determination or resolve in advance; an antecedent intention to do something
name: predetermination
examples: he entered the argument with a predetermination to prove me wrong

definition: the act of determining or ordaining in advance what is to take place
name: predetermination

definition: determine beforehand
name: predetermine

definition: cause to be biased
name: predetermine

definition: set in advance
name: predetermined
examples: at a predetermined time

definition: a situation from which extrication is difficult especially an unpleasant or trying one
name: predicament
examples: finds himself in a most awkward predicament

definition: (logic) what is predicated of the subject of a proposition; the second term in a proposition is predicated of the first term by means of the copula
name: predicate
examples: `Socrates is a man' predicates manhood of Socrates

definition: one of the two main constituents of a sentence; the predicate contains the verb and its complements
name: predicate

definition: make the (grammatical) predicate in a proposition
name: predicate
examples: The predicate `dog' is predicated of the subject `Fido' in the sentence `Fido is a dog'

definition: affirm or declare as an attribute or quality of
name: predicate
examples: The speech predicated the fitness of the candidate to be President

definition: involve as a necessary condition of consequence; as in logic
name: predicate
examples: solving the problem is predicated on understanding it well

definition: a system of symbolic logic that represents individuals and predicates and quantification over individuals (as well as the relations between propositions)
name: predicate calculus

definition: (logic) a declaration of something self-evident; something that can be assumed as the basis for argument
name: predication

definition: of adjectives; relating to or occurring within the predicate of a sentence
name: predicative
examples: `red' is a predicative adjective in `the apple is red'

definition: occurring within the predicate phrase
name: predicatively
examples: predicatively used adjectives

definition: an expression that predicates
name: predicator

definition: make a prediction about; tell in advance
name: predict

definition: indicate, as with a sign or an omen
name: predict

definition: the quality of being predictable
name: predictability

definition: capable of being foretold
name: predictable

definition: in a predictable manner or to a predictable degree
name: predictably
examples: predictably, he did not like the news

definition: the act of predicting (as by reasoning about the future)
name: prediction

definition: a statement made about the future
name: prediction

definition: of or relating to prediction; having value for making predictions
name: predictive

definition: someone who makes predictions of the future (usually on the basis of special knowledge)
name: predictor
